column1: Therefore in  light of the  above  sources  it  is  clear that the  meaning of a provision of a
statute  should  be  elicited  from  the  intention of the  Parliament and such interpretation
must not violate meaning of the words that are expressly used.
Thus,  [ am  of the  opinion  that  the  word "shall be  deemed guilty "  used  in  Section 60

(7)  of the  Consumer  Affairs  Authority  Act,  No.09  of 2003  has  to  be 
interpreted  in

such  a  way 
that  a  body  corporate  and  every  director  and  officer  of  such  body
